com.xively.messaging

Interface XiMessaging

  • All Superinterfaces:
    XiService

    public interface XiMessaging
extends XiService
    Provides basic IoT messaging features to send and receive messages.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  XiMessaging.State
      Internal state of the Messaging service.
      static class  XiMessaging.XiMessagingQoS
      QoS values channel subscribe and data publish.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Closes the current messaging service instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getState

        XiMessaging.State getState()
        Returns the current state of the Messaging service.
        Returns:
        A XiMessaging.State value.

      • addDataListener

        void addDataListener(XiMessagingDataListener listener)
        Add a listener for data send and receive events. If a listener instance is already added, further add invocations do nothing.
        Parameters:
        listener - The XiMessagingDataListener instance to be added.

      • removeDataListener

        void removeDataListener(XiMessagingDataListener listener)
        Removes a registered data listener instance. No further event callbacks will be made to this data listener. This method does nothing if a listener has been already removed or has never been added to the current messaging service instance.
        Parameters:
        listener - The XiMessagingDataListener instance to be removed.

      • addStateListener

        void addStateListener(XiMessagingStateListener listener)
        Add a listener to monitor state changes of the messaging service. If a listener has already been added, further invocations of the add method will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        listener - An XiMessagingStateListener instance.

      • removeStateListener

        void removeStateListener(XiMessagingStateListener listener)
        Removes a registered state listener instance. No further status event callbacks will be made to this data listener. This method does nothing if a listener has been already removed or has never been added to the current messaging service instance.
        Parameters:
        listener - An XiMessagingStateListener instance.

      • addSubscriptionListener

        void addSubscriptionListener(XiMessagingSubscriptionListener listener)
        Register a listener for message channel subscription events. The listener provides callbacks for subscription failure and success.
        Parameters:
        listener - An XiMessagingSubscriptionListener instance.

      • removeSubscriptionListener

        void removeSubscriptionListener(XiMessagingSubscriptionListener listener)
        Removes a subscription listener from the current messaging service instance. The listener will receive no further subscription event callbacks. This method does nothing if a listener has been already removed or has never been added to the current messaging service instance.
        Parameters:
        listener - An XiMessagingSubscriptionListener instance.

      • publish

        int publish(java.lang.String channel,
            byte[] message,
            XiMessaging.XiMessagingQoS qos)
     throws XiException.NotConnectedException
        Publish a message to the specified channel of an IoT device.
        Parameters:
        channel - The messaging channel for the message.
        message - The message as a byte array.
        qos - The QoS value of the publish. For details see XiMessaging.XiMessagingQoS.
        Returns:
        The id of the message is returned or -1 if delivery confirmation is not supported for the current connection or messaging channel. The delivery confirmation event can be monitored using the XiMessagingDataListener's onDataSent callback.
        Throws:
        XiException.NotConnectedException - Publish will throw a XiException.NotConnectedException exception if the underlying connection is not connected, respectively the Messaging service is not in Running state.

      • publish

        int publish(java.lang.String channel,
            byte[] message,
            XiMessaging.XiMessagingQoS qos,
            boolean retain)
     throws XiException.NotConnectedException
        Publish a message to the specified channel of an IoT device.
        Parameters:
        channel - The messaging channel for the message.
        message - The message as a byte array.
        qos - The QoS value of the publish. For details see XiMessaging.XiMessagingQoS.
        retain - The retain flag of the message.
        Returns:
        The id of the message is returned or -1 if delivery confirmation is not supported for the current connection or messaging channel. The delivery confirmation event can be monitored using the XiMessagingDataListener's onDataSent callback.
        Throws:
        XiException.NotConnectedException - Publish will throw a XiException.NotConnectedException exception if the underlying connection is not connected, respectively the Messaging service is not in Running state.

      • subscribe

        void subscribe(java.lang.String channel,
               XiMessaging.XiMessagingQoS qos)
        throws XiException.NotConnectedException,
               XiException.ConnectionException
        Subscribe to receive publishes on a specified IoT device messaging channel. XiMessagingSubscriptionListener listeners can be used to monitor the success or failure of the subscribe operation.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel of your IoT device.
        qos - The QoS value for the current subscription. For details see XiMessaging.XiMessagingQoS.
        Throws:
        XiException.NotConnectedException - This method will throw a XiException.NotConnectedException if the underlying connection is not connected, respectively the Messaging service is not in Running state.
        XiException.ConnectionException - This method will throw a XiException.ConnectionException if the subscribe operation has immediately failed.

      • unsubscribe

        void unsubscribe(java.lang.String channel)
          throws XiException.NotConnectedException,
                 XiException.ConnectionException
        Unsubscribes from the specified IoT device messaging channel. No further data events will be monitored on this channel. XiMessagingSubscriptionListener listeners can be used to monitor the success or failure of the unsubscribe operation.
        Parameters:
        channel - The device messaging channel.
        Throws:
        XiException.NotConnectedException - This method will throw a XiException.NotConnectedException if the underlying connection is not connected, respectively the Messaging service is not in Running state.
        XiException.ConnectionException - This method will throw a XiException.ConnectionException if the unsubscribe operation has immediately failed.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the current messaging service instance. For a new Messaging connection a new Messaging Creator must be obtained from the current XiSession instance.
